New Records: Jasprit Bumrah took 2/19 in 7 overs for India in the match.
Shubman Gill scored 16 runs off 11 balls, the fastest half-century in the match.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 7 wickets with 117 balls remaining.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match for his bowling performance.
Pre-Game Insights: India elected to field first after winning the toss.
Pakistan's batting order struggled, with key players like Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan dismissed cheaply.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team's performance and resilience after the win.
The match was India's first in the World Cup 2023-24 season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad.
It was a day-night match with a 50-over format.
Others: The match was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24 series.
